channel.title: On Mac, Undo is bound to Ctrl-Z instead of Cmd-Z
channel.description:
#### What happened?
I tried undoing a change to my logs with Cmd-Z. Nothing happened. Instead, Ctrl-Z is undo.
#### What was SUPPOSED to happen?
Cmd-Z should have performed Undo, as Cmd-C/X/V are the Mac ToL clipboard hotkeys and Cmd-Z is system-normal.
#### Steps to reproduce:
Type something on Mac, try to Undo with Cmd-Z. Then try with Ctrl-Z.
#### Comments:
This has screwed me over in trials a whole bunch. :/
